ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsẅii mbwó Mǒonsê pɔ́ Áloŋ ngie:
en: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron:

ngiemboon: Pi tsẅii mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ngie: À gʉa na menɔ̀ɔn pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ ntsèm, e pie pi ge láʼa pfɛ́ɛ, pi júʼ.
en: “Tell the Israelites: You may eat   all these kinds of land animals.  # 11:2 Dt 14:4–21; Ac 10:9–16; Rm 14:14

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ngwɔ́ pi láʼa ḿpfɛ́ɛ menɔ̀ɔn pie é gẅiin menkǐb shʉashʉ̌a, lé mekwò shʉashʉ̌a, ńgÿo pie é pfɛ́ɛ legǐ ḿbiŋ ńgẅíʼi tá ḿpfɛ́.
en: You may eat any animal with divided hooves and that chews the cud.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pie é pfɛ́ɛ legǐ ḿbiŋe ńgẅíʼi tá ḿpfɛ́ kà pie é gẅiin menkǐb shʉashʉ̌a wɔ́ɔ: É pie ngwɔ́ pi le pfɛ́ é pɔɔn: wɔɔn aa kamɛɛ gẅie à pfɛ́ɛ legǐ ḿbiŋ ńgẅíʼi tá ńgíŋe ḿpfɛ́, tá ńké té gẅiin menkǐb shʉashʉ̌a wɔ́, aa we nzse mbwó pi.
en: But among the ones that chew the cud or have divided hooves you are not to eat these:

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn gwɔ́ nɔ̀ɔn tsẅɛ́ gẅie mé toŋo lé lapêŋ mbàʼ, gẅie à pfɛ́ɛ legǐ ḿbiŋ ńgẅíʼi tá ńgíŋe ḿpfɛ́, tá ńké té gẅiin menkǐb shʉashʉ̌a wɔ́, ée nzse mbwó pi lépfɛ́.
en: hyraxes,   though they chew the cud,

ngiemboon: Ncʉ̀a, aa tsɔ̌ nɔ̀ɔn gẅie à gẅíʼi legǐ, ńgíŋe ḿpfɛ́, tá ńké té gẅiin menkǐb shʉashʉ̌a wɔ́, ée nzse mbwó pi lépfɛ́.
en: hares, though they chew the cud,

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn áa kúnɔ̀ɔn gẅie á gẅiin menkǐb shʉashʉ̌a ńgÿo mekwò shʉashʉ̌a, táʼ, ńké té pfɛ́ɛ legǐ ḿbiŋ ńgẅíʼi tá ńgíŋe ḿpfɛ́ wɔ́. Aa mbwó pi ńgwɔ́ gẅie á gẅiin ncÿǒ.
en: pigs, though they have divided hooves,

ngiemboon: Pi těen ńdáʼa ḿpfɛ́ɛ mbab yɔ́b wɔ́, ńké le pfó yɔ́b kíbe, pɔ́ ée mbwó pi, ńgwɔ́ menɔ̀ɔn ncÿǒ.
en: Do not eat any of their meat or touch their carcasses #— #they are unclean for you.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na menɔ̀ɔn ntsèm pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, é pie ngwɔ́ pi láʼ ḿpfɛ́ é pɔɔn: Ngwɔ́ pi láʼ ḿpfɛ́ pie é gẅiin membabá, ńgÿo mengùb nkaʼte kaʼte lélɔg ḿbyé kɔ́ɔn, ḿbiŋe ńtsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ púɔ mentse kà tsɛ̀ɛ mentse tépàa wɔ́ɔ.
en: “This is what you may eat from all that is in the water: You may eat everything in the water that has fins and scales, whether in the seas or streams.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńgʉa na gígyé menɔ̀ɔn pie é tsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ mentse kà tsɛ̀ɛ mí wɔ́ɔ, kà tsɛ̀ɛ mentse tépàa wɔ́ɔ, á mmó ntsèm gie á té mbabá kà mengùb nkaʼte kaʼte wɔ́ɔ gẅiin, á ge gwɔ́ mmó tepòŋ mbwó pi.
en: But these are to be abhorrent to you: everything in the seas or streams that does not have fins and scales among all the swarming things and other living creatures   in the water.

ngiemboon: Pi těen ńdáʼa ḿpfɛ́ɛ mbab yɔ́b wɔ́; á ge láʼ gwɔ́ lɔ̌ʼ mbwó pi lézába pwó na pfó yɔ́b. Pi gẅiin lélíe pɔɔn menɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ é sẅé gẅi sẅé.
en: They are to remain abhorrent to you; you must not eat any of their meat, and you must abhor their carcasses.

ngiemboon: Ammó ntsèm gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntse á té membabá kà mengùb nkaʼte kaʼte wɔ́ɔ gẅiin, á ge láʼ gwɔ́ mmó lɔ̌ʼ mbwó pi.
en: Everything in the water that does not have fins and scales will be abhorrent to you.

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ meshʉ̌ŋ, é pie pi ge láʼ gyá e sẅé gẅi sẅe tà pi é le pfɛ́: wɔɔn aa gúmndóŋ we kwoŋo, wɔɔn gwɔ́ tsɔ́ ntí meshʉ̌ŋ páʼ megúmndóŋ, ńgÿo megúmndóŋ pe ntse.
en: “You are to abhor these birds. They must not be eaten because they are abhorrent:

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ée ngẅìlepàb mbɔɔ pfòŋ, ńgÿo tsɔ̌ ntí meshʉ̌ŋ páʼ pɛ̌.
en: kites,

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn gwɔ́ ŋeŋá pâ tsɔ̌ ntí meshʉ̌ŋ páʼ pɛ̌.
en: every kind of raven,

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn gwɔ́ tsɔ́ máa ncùm, wɔɔn gwɔ́ pfòŋ, mbɔɔ shùshù, mágúm, ńgÿo tém mentí mentí.
en: ostriches,

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn gwɔ́ ndÿóon, wɔɔn gwɔ́ méshʉ́ŋ gẅie à pyé kɔ́ɔn ntse, ńgÿo ndʉ̀m.
en: little   owls, cormorants,  # 11:17 Or pelicans

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn aa tàʼ shʉa lóŋ mendoŋfágwele pe ntse, ńgÿo sẅisẅi ncwò ndoŋfágwele lâ pe tsẅɛ.
en: barn   owls, eagle owls,  # 11:18 Or pelicans, or horned owls,# 11:18 Dt 14:17; Ps 102:6; Is 34:11; Zph 2:14

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn aa pàŋncwò, yɔɔn gwɔ́ ncùm ńgÿo tsɔ̌ ntí meshʉ̌ŋ páʼ pɛ̌. Wɔɔn gwɔ́ shʉ́ŋntsɔ̀ʼ ńgÿo ndÿóon.
en: storks,

ngiemboon: Megígyé menɔ̀ɔn pie é gẅiin mbabá, ḿbiŋe ńdɔgɔ mekwò lekùɔ ńgiŋe, é ge láʼa gwɔ́ mmó nzse mbwó pi.
en: “All winged insects that walk on all fours are to be abhorrent to you.

ngiemboon: Tàʼ, ńgʉa na gígyé menɔ̀ɔn ntsèm pie é gẅiin mbabá, ḿbiŋ ńgẅiin mekwò lekùɔ lélɔg ńkyɛ́te, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi pfɛ́.
en: But you may eat these kinds of all the winged insects that walk on all fours: those that have jointed legs above their feet for hopping on the ground.

ngiemboon: É pie ngwɔ́ pi láʼ ḿpfɛ́ é pɔɔn: Ngwɔ́ pi pfɛ́ ngǐm mentí mentí ńgÿo membʉ̀le.
en: You may eat these:

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na metsɔ́ megígyé menɔ̀ɔn ntsèm pie é gẅiin mbabá, ńgẅiin mekwò lekùɔ, é ge láʼ gwɔ́ mmó tepòŋ mbwó pi.
en: All other winged insects that have four feet are to be abhorrent to you.

ngiemboon: Pɔɔn ée menɔ̀ɔn pie ngwɔ́ pi láʼ ńcʉa mǒ ńcʉ́ʼ pʉ̀a ncÿǒ: Á nue nyìŋ gẅie à zabá pwó na mepfó mɔ́b, à ge cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ tà tyé mbÿɛ̀njÿó.
en: “These will make you unclean. Whoever touches their carcasses will be unclean   until evening,

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à kǎa mepfó mɔ́b, à ge sɔg menzsǒ mé, é cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ tà tyé mbÿɛ̀njÿó.
en: and whoever carries any of their carcasses is to wash his clothes and will be unclean until evening.

ngiemboon: Nɔ̀ɔn ntsèm gẅie à gẅiin menkǐb shʉashʉ̌a ḿbiŋ ńké té pfɛ́ɛ legǐ ńgẅíʼi tá ńgíŋe ḿpfɛ́ɛ wɔ́, á ge gwɔ́ nɔ̀ɔn lɔ̌ʼ mbwó pi: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzába pwó yé na yé, mbà à ge cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ.
en: All animals that have hooves but do not have a divided hoof and do not chew the cud are unclean for you. Whoever touches them becomes unclean.

ngiemboon: Menɔ̀ɔn ntsèm pie é gẅiin mekwò lekùɔ, ḿbiŋ ńké te menkǐb gẅiin, é ge gwɔ́ pe nzse mbwó pi: Á nue Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzába pwó na mepfó mɔ́b, mbà à ge cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ tà tyé mbÿɛ̀njÿó.
en: All the four-footed animals   that walk on their paws are unclean for you. Whoever touches their carcasses will be unclean until evening,

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, mbɔɔ wɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ gẅie à kǎa mepfó mɔ́b, à ge sɔg menzsǒ mé, é piŋ cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ tà tyé mbÿɛ̀njÿó, pɛ̌ menɔ̀ɔn ée mbwó pi ńgwɔ́ shúm nzse.
en: and anyone who carries their carcasses is to wash his clothes and will be unclean until evening. They are unclean for you.

ngiemboon: Pi gyá, áa tsetsɛ̀ɛ gígyé menɔ̀ɔn pie é shwoŋo lepfòm sɔ́b ssé, e pie ée mbwó pi ńgwɔ́ shúm ncÿǒ é pɔɔn: wɔɔn gwɔ́ tsɔ́ máa mbâandum gẅie à tsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ tsetsáʼ, wɔɔn gwɔ́ cʉ̀cʉ̀a, ńgÿo membèpàpǐŋ mentí mentí;
en: “These creatures that swarm   on the ground are unclean for you:

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn gwɔ́ kùkwòonmelùŋoʼ, mbɔɔ tètɔ̀ʼntsɔ̀ɔn, wɔɔn gwɔ́ pfómankwɔ̀ʼ, mbɔɔ sáasekɔ̀b pɔ́ kénáŋmandóŋ.
en: geckos, monitor lizards,

ngiemboon: Megígyé menɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ ntsèm, ée pe ncÿǒ mbwó pi, mbɔɔ wɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ gẅie à zabá pwó yé na pfó tsɔ̌, á fʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ kweté, à ge cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ tà tyé ncwònzém.
en: These are unclean for you among all the swarming creatures. Whoever touches them when they are dead will be unclean until evening.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ tàʼ na pɔ́b lɔɔn ńkwé, ḿbiŋ gwe na mmó, mbà yɛ̌ mmó cʉ́ʼʉ mmó ncÿǒ: Mé gɔɔn shúm páʼ lepfwɔʼ sie mé lɔgɔ tÿǒ ńkwóon, páʼ nzsǒ, páʼ ngùb, ńgÿo pɔ̀ɔn. Apàga káŋ ntsèm gie mé lɔgɔ faʼa fàʼ; á gie mmó ŋwɛ́ gwě mǒ, mé ge láʼ sɔg, à ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mmó ncÿǒ tà ncwònzém láʼ ńgwɔ́, tá á le gíŋe ńgwɔ́ mmó ncÿǒ wɔ́.
en: When any one of them dies and falls on anything it becomes unclean #— #any item of wood, clothing, leather, sackcloth,   or any implement used for work. It is to be rinsed with water and will remain unclean until evening; then it will be clean.

ngiemboon: Ammó ntsèm gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ngwʉ̌ŋ tsáʼ, é gẅie tsɔ́ táʼ na pɔ́b gwě tsɛ̀ɛ wó, à ge láʼ cʉ́ʼʉ mmó ncÿǒ, pi piŋ éshʉ́ate wɛ̌ ngwʉ̌ŋ.
en: If any of them falls into any clay pot, everything in it will become unclean; you are to break it.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn pfɛte ntse gẅie é fó tsɛ̀ɛ wɛ̌ ngwʉ̌ŋ, á na shúm léjÿó sie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé pfɛ́, mbà sɛ̌ ge cʉ́ʼʉ mmó ncÿǒ: ńké ńgwɔ́ gie áa mmó nú nǔ, ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ ntí ngwʉ̌ŋ wɔ́ɔ, mbà á ge cʉ́ʼʉ mmó ncÿǒ.
en: Any edible food   coming into contact with that unclean water will become unclean, and any drinkable liquid in any container will become unclean.

ngiemboon: Ammó ntsèm gie pfó tsɔ́ tàʼ gwě mǒ, ge cʉ́ʼʉ mmó ncÿǒ; á gie é lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ letǔɔ mbelég pɔ́ lekyè mmɔ̌g, mbà é ge cʉ́ʼʉ mmó ncÿǒ, é gwɔ́ mbwó pi gwɔ́ mmó ncÿǒ; mé pú ńtág.
en: Anything one of their carcasses falls on will become unclean. If it is an oven or stove, it is to be smashed; it is unclean and will remain unclean for you.

ngiemboon: Á gie pfó nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ lɔɔn ńgwe tsɛ̀ɛ metàʼ ntse kà tsɛ̀ɛ tâŋ ntse wɔ́ɔ, mbà lɔ̌ʼ té gwɔ́ na ntse wɔ́; táʼ, nyìŋ gẅie à kẅilé pfó, à cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ gẅie à kǎ lɔ̌ʼ.
en: A spring or cistern containing water will remain clean, but someone who touches a carcass in it will become unclean.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ tàʼ na mepfó mɔ́b lɔɔn ńgwe na mbyè mmó gie mé gee ḿbyě, mbà é te gẅiin ncÿǒ wɔ́;
en: If one of their carcasses falls on any seed that is to be sown, it is clean;

ngiemboon: táʼ, ńké ngwɔ́ gie mé tsǎb mbyé mmó, tá tsɔ́ tàʼ ná mepfó mɔ́b gwe mǒ, mbà é ge cʉ́ʼʉ mmó ncÿǒ mbwó pi.
en: but if water has been put on the seed and one of their carcasses falls on it, it is unclean for you.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ tàʼ na menɔ̀ɔn pie ngwɔ́ pi pfɛ́ lɔɔn ńkwé, mbà nyìŋ gẅie à kibé pfó yé zɔ ge cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ, púʼu tà ncwònzém à láʼ ńgwɔ́;
en: “If one of the animals that you use for food dies, anyone who touches its carcass will be unclean until evening.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à pfɛ̌ yɛ̌ ntí pfó nɔ̀ɔn ge sɔg menzsǒ mé, é piŋ cʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ gẅie à kǎ lɔ̌ʼ púʼu tà tyé ncwònzém, nyìŋ gẅie à pǐŋ ńkaa yɛ̌ ntí pfó nɔ̀ɔn, à sɔg menzsǒ mé, ńcʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ ncÿǒ púʼu tà tyé ncwònzém.
en: Anyone who eats some of its carcass is to wash his clothes and will be unclean until evening. Anyone who carries its carcass must wash his clothes and will be unclean until evening.

ngiemboon: Megígyé menɔ̀ɔn ntsèm pie é pú ńkʉ́ʼʉ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, pɛ̌ ée shúm nzse; mé těen ńdáʼa ḿpfɛ́ɛ wɔ́b wɔ́.
en: “All the creatures that swarm on the earth are abhorrent; they must not be eaten.

ngiemboon: Pi těen ńdáʼa ḿpfɛ́ɛ tsɔ́ tàʼ na gígyé menɔ̀ɔn pie é shwoŋo lepfòm sɔ́b ssé wɔ́, ńké le pfɛ́ pie é giŋe mekwò lekùɔ wɔ́, kà pɔ́ pie é zɔɔn ńtɔ́g mekwò lekùɔ wɔ́ɔ: Epɛ̌ ée shúm sie mé pú ḿbʉa.
en: Do not eat any of the creatures that swarm on the earth, anything that moves on its belly or walks on all fours or on many feet,   for they are abhorrent.

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ gẅí lézába pwó na pɔɔn megígyé menɔ̀ɔn pie é kʉʼʉ, ńdɔg mbùm nnɛ́ gi ńgÿo mmó ncÿǒ; mbɔɔ gẅí legÿo tàʼ na menɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ cʉa na pi, ḿbɔ́gɔ gẅí lécʉ́ʼ shúm ncÿǒ.
en: Do not become contaminated by any creature that swarms; do not become unclean or defiled by them.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gi: Pi gwɔ́ ndʉalʉ̌a, páʼ mèŋ n gee ndʉalʉ̌a, pi pɔ́ɔn lézába pwó na pɔɔn megígyé menɔ̀ɔn pie é kʉ́ʼʉ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, ńdɔg mbùm nnɛ́ gi ńgÿo mmó ncÿǒ.
en: For I am the Lord your God,   so you must consecrate yourselves  # 11:44 Ex 19:22; Lv 20:7; Nm 11:18; Ezk 38:23 and be holy because I am holy.  # 11:44 Lv 19:2; 20:7,26; 1Pt 1:16 Do not defile yourselves by any swarming creature that crawls on the ground.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee Cʉ̀apʉ̀a: Mèŋ zɔ la fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅile gẅí lécʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ Ssé gi, pi ge cʉ́ʼ ndʉalʉ̌a mélàʼmie mèŋ n gee ndʉalʉ̌a.
en: For I am the Lord, who brought you up from the land of Egypt to be your God,   so you must be holy because I am holy.  # 11:45 Lv 21:8

ngiemboon: Sɔɔn lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ lepʉ̌ sie é líe nò na menɔ̀ɔn pie ée ntʉ̀ntʉ̀, ńdíe nò na meshʉ̌ŋ, á na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie á gẅiin zẅìge ńtsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, tà mbɔɔ na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie á gẅiin zẅìge ńkʉ́ʼʉ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ.
en: “This is the law concerning animals, birds, all living creatures that move in the water, and all creatures that swarm on the ground,

ngiemboon: Sɛ̌ lɔg ńgwɔ́ lepʉ̌ sie ngwɔ́ mé cʉa mǒ, ńzsé nɔ̀ɔn gẅie áa we nzse pɔ́ gẅie à te nzse gẅiin, lélɔg ńzsé gẅie ngwɔ́ mé pfɛ́ pɔ́ gẅie ngwɔ́ mé le pfɛ́.
en: in order to distinguish between the unclean and the clean, between the animals   that may be eaten and those that may not be eaten.”
